messages.content: Stiction can be detected using the provided image. Its characteristic is a butterfly-like shape in the graph, and the more it resembles the butterfly shape, the more severe the stiction.
<image>Does the control loop exhibit stiction?
Yes, stiction is present in this control loop.
What is the basis for your conclusion?
The butterfly shape is evident in the image.
To detect stiction, refer to the provided image. Stiction is characterized by a butterfly-like shape in the graph, with greater similarity indicating more severe stiction.
<image>Is stiction present in the control loop?
Yes, stiction exists in this control loop.
What is the basis for your conclusion?
The butterfly shape is clearly visible in the image.
Use the provided image to detect stiction. It is characterized by a butterfly-like shape in the graph, and the similarity to this shape indicates the severity of stiction.
<image>Is there stiction in the control loop?
No, there is no stiction in this control loop.
Why do you say that?
The butterfly shape is not present in the image.
